title: Man playing with AR-15 shoots Ark. 13-year-old
content:
HOT SPRINGS, Ark. (KTHV) – Hot Springs police said an adult playing with a gun shot a 13-year-old in the leg while someone was taking photos of the weapon.
Kirk Zaner with the Hot Springs Police Department said 20-year-old Jesse Alan Flemister was playing with an AR-15 semi-automatic rifle on April 10 around 6:45 p.m. when he fired an accidental shot.
Zaner said Flemister has been charged with second-degree battery and is being held in lieu of $20,000 bond at the Garland County Detention Center while the teen has been taken to a hospital in critical condition.
According to the incident report, there were five individuals at the home when officers arrived. Officer narrative details that Flemister told police he had pulled the bolt back on the weapon and was unaware that it was loaded. When the bolt slid forward, Flemister is said to have told officers that the weapon then discharged, hitting the 13-year-old.
The narrative describes alcohol bottles being strewn about the living area of the house, and Flemister was described as smelling of intoxicants. He told police that he had smoked marijuana before the incident occurred.
